definition: to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to eat till full/satisfied
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: There is so much litchi in Shenzhen. I can eat as many as I like.
sentences.chinese: 深圳的荔枝真多，我可以大饱口福了。

sentences.english: We hope you'll also get a feast for your appetite.
sentences.chinese: 也希望这淮扬菜能让您大饱口福。

sentences.english: We feasted on chicken and coconuts.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃鸡肉和椰子，大饱口福。

sentences.english: But I think it not only gluts my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 不过我觉得这些不光能让人大饱口福。

sentences.english: It seems we'll have gourmet's luck today.
sentences.chinese: 看来我们今天真是可以大饱口福了。

definition: to gorge oneself/to eat heartily (idiom)
delicious/tasty
delicious/delicious food/delicacy
to chew on a large slab (idiom); a large mouthful is hard to chew/to tuck into a great meal
to taste a small amount/to sample
to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
happy knack for chancing upon fine food
culinary delicacy/fine food/gourmet food
to smell, look and taste great
to feast one's eyes
fine food/delicacies/delicious food
to satisfy one's craving
great meal fit for dragon's son (idiom); sumptuous banquet
lit. to drool with desire (idiom)/fig. to hunger for/greedy
gourmand
to eat one's fill/to be full
